00041 #define PRINT_TIME(t1,t2,str) cout << "Time taken to " #str << " : " << (t2-t1).seconds() << " secs" << endl

00045 typedef int32_t cnt_t; //A type for counts
00046 typedef int32_t topic_t; //A type for topics
00047 typedef int32_t word_t; //A type for words

00056 typedef std::pair<int, int> bigram_key_t;
00057 
00058 /*typedef struct{
00059  float* values;
00060  int length;

00062  }Parameters;*/
00063 
00064 typedef struct {
00065     //A structure to conveniently
00066     //and portably access topics
00067     //and counts separately. We try
00068     //to avoid direct access when
00069     //speed is not a major concern
00070     topic_t top;
00071     cnt_t cnt;
00072 } choose_t;
00073 
00074 typedef union {
00075     //The main structure for the storage
00076     //and access of (topic,counts) in a
00077     //packed fashion.
00078     //Example: (100,10) is stored in pkd form
00079     //using cnt_top_t ct; ct.choose.top=100;
00080     //ct.choose.cnt=10; Access is similar.
00081     //This is the only portable way of doing
00082     //it. The moment you start accessing portions
00083     //of cnt_top directly, you make assumptions
00084     //on the order of struct storage and endianness.
00085     //There are parts in sampler & TopicCounts which are
00086     //totally arch specific and are not portable
00087     //This was done to improve performance
00088     packed_t cnt_top;
00089     choose_t choose;
00090 } cnt_topic_t;
00091 
00092 typedef tbb::spin_rw_mutex word_mutex_t; //A type for read,write spin lock
00093 
00094 typedef struct {
00095     //Message type to store the
00096     //changes suggested by sampler
00097     word_t word;
00098     topic_t old_topic;
00099     topic_t new_topic;
00100     int old_indicator;
00101     int new_indicator;
00102 } change_elem_t;
00103 
00104 typedef struct {
00105     //Message type between sampler
00106     //and updater
00107     LDA::unigram_document* doc;
00108     std::vector<change_elem_t>* change_list;
00109     bool ignore_old_topic;
00110 } update_t;
00111 
00112 typedef boost::mt19937 base_generator_type; //variate generator used by RNGS

00114 typedef std::pair<topic_t, float> tppair; //(topic,proportion) pair used in dumping
00115 //topic proportions to disk

00117 typedef std::pair<word_t, float> wppair; //(word,proportion) pair

00119 
00120 typedef std::pair<int, int> id2freq_t; //(word_id,frequency) used in dictionary to compute
00121 //and maintain word frequencies
00122 
00123 /**
00124  * Exception thrown when an old topic is not found
00125  * This is fatal and causes the program to stop
00126  */
00127 class InvalidOldTopicExc: public std::exception {
00128     word_t word;
00129     topic_t old_topic;
00130 
00131 public:
00132     InvalidOldTopicExc(word_t word_, topic_t old_topic_) {
00133         word = word_;
00134         old_topic = old_topic_;
00135     }
00136 
00137     virtual const char* what() const throw () {
00138         std::ostringstream ret;
00139         ret << "The old topic " << old_topic
00140                 << " argument is invalid for the word " << word;
00141         return ret.str().c_str();
00142     }
00143 };

00145 typedef boost::unordered_map<topic_t, cnt_t> mapped_vec; //The type for map used in topicCounts
